meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or derived from amber or succinic acid.
meanings.sent1: The succinic gem sparkled in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: Her succinic necklace matched her earrings perfectly.
meanings.sent3: The succinic stone seemed to glow mysteriously.
meanings.sent4: The succinic jewelry held a piece of ancient history.
meanings.sent5: The succinic color of the gem was captivating.

meanings.sent1: The succinic aroma of the dish filled the room.
meanings.sent2: The succinic taste of the sauce was tangy and sweet.
meanings.sent3: She joked that the succinic flavor made her feel like a chef.
meanings.sent4: The succinic scent brought back memories of baking with grandma.
meanings.sent5: The succinic flavor lingered on his taste buds.

meanings.definition: A salt or ester of succinic acid.
meanings.sent1: The succinic was used in the production of medicine.
meanings.sent2: She added a pinch of succinic to the solution.
meanings.sent3: The succinic sat on the lab shelf, waiting to be used.
meanings.sent4: The succinic enhanced the effectiveness of the remedy.
meanings.sent5: The succinic was a key ingredient in the formula.
